p: Natural plant products tend to have low mammalian toxicity, broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity, are less hazardous than synthetic compounds, and are generally more acceptable to the public [ 4, 7, 12, 14, 15, 16]. At present, there are many research results on the efficacy of plant volatiles to control fungal and microbial growth in in vitro (laboratory) conditions [ 17, 18], but very few discuss their efficacy to extend the shelf life of fresh produce.
